intro: Dictyanthus pavonii, commonly known as the rainbow crown, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences that resemble a crown, with vibrant hues of red, orange, and yellow. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its showy, tubular flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
